description: Describes the specified bundle tasks or all of your bundle tasks.

parameters.name: BundleIds
parameters.description: The bundle task IDs. Default: Describes all your bundle tasks. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. bundle-id - The ID of the bundle task. error-code - If the task failed, the error code returned. error-message - If the task failed, the error message returned. instance-id - The ID of the instance. progress - The level of task completion, as a percentage (for example, 20%). s3-bucket - The Amazon S3 bucket to store the AMI. s3-prefix - The beginning of the AMI name. start-time - The time the task started (for example, 2013-09-15T17:15:20.000Z). state - The state of the task ( pending | waiting-for-shutdown | bundling | storing | cancelling | complete | failed). update-time - The time of the most recent update for the task. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the instance associated with this bundle task.

nested_items.name: BundleId
nested_items.description: The ID of the bundle task.

nested_items.name: UpdateTime
nested_items.description: The time of the most recent update for the task.

nested_items.name: AWSAccessKeyId
nested_items.description: The access key ID of the owner of the bucket. Before you specify a value for your access key ID, review and follow the guidance in Best Practices for Amazon Web Services accounts in the Account ManagementReference Guide.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The bucket in which to store the AMI. You can specify a bucket that you already own or a new bucket that Amazon EC2 creates on your behalf. If you specify a bucket that belongs to someone else, Amazon EC2 returns an error.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The beginning of the file name of the AMI.

nested_items.name: UploadPolicy
nested_items.description: An Amazon S3 upload policy that gives Amazon EC2 permission to upload items into Amazon S3 on your behalf.

nested_items.name: UploadPolicySignature
nested_items.description: The signature of the JSON document.

nested_items.name: Progress
nested_items.description: The level of task completion, as a percent (for example, 20%).

nested_items.name: BundleTaskError
nested_items.description: If the task fails, a description of the error.
